post.summary: Uploads a file to your endpoint cloud service. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created.

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: On optional flag indicating if the destination file should overwritten, if one already exists at the destination path. If this parameter is omitted or set to false, and the destination file already exists, then the file will not be overwritten and an error will be returned.
parameters.name: overwrite

parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination file. Path is required and no other fields are supported.
parameters.name: body

post.summary: Copies a file specified by a file path to another file path, leaving the original intact.  If the source file path does not exist an error response is returned.  If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created.  Copying a file that already exists results in an error response.

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: The expiration date for the link created if one doesn't already exist.  The default is for the link to never expire.
parameters.name: expires

parameters.description: The visibility for the link created if one doesn't already exist.  Valid values are PUBLIC, TEAM_ONLY, and PASSWORD. The default is PUBLIC.
parameters.name: visibility

parameters.description: The password to protect the link with if the visibility is set to PASSWORD.
parameters.name: password

patch.summary: Update a file's metadata (tags and path) associated with a path.  For example, if you had a document that was tagged as operations but needed to be tagged as legal, then you would perform a PATCH to update the tag using the tags JSON array field. The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a file as well as move a file by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a file.

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: The number of items returned in a query. Defaults to 100 if not supplied
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

patch.summary: Update a file's metadata (tags and path) associated with an ID.  For example, if you had a document that was tagged as operations but needed to be tagged as legal, then you would perform a PATCH to update the tag using the tags JSON array field. The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a file as well as move a file by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a file.

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

CloudFileResp.description: File information describe file objects in Box, with attributes like who created the file, when it was last modified, and other information.

createdDate.description: When this file was created on Box's servers

id.description: The ID of the file object

modifiedDate.description: When this file was last updated on the Box servers. This is a read-only field.

path.description: The path of folders to this item, starting at the root

size.description: Size of this file in bytes

tags.description: All tags applied to this file

createdDate.description: The time the folder was created. May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

parentFolderId.description:
The folder that contains this folder.
                           May be null for folders such as root, trash and child folders whose parent is inaccessible.

id.description: The ID of the folder object

modifiedDate.description: When this folder was last updated on the Box servers. This is a read-only field.

path.description: The path of folders to this folder, starting at the root.

tags.description: All tags applied to this file

description.x-samplevalue: These properties will describe how confidential this file or folder is.

CloudLink.description: Get the shared link for a file or folder

providerLink.description: The 'direct Link' URL to download the item. If entered in a browser, this URL will trigger a download of the item. This URL includes the file extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

providerViewLink.description: The URL to access the item on Box. If entered in a browser, this URL will display the item in Box's preview UI. If a custom URL is set this field will return the custom URL, but the original URL will also continue to work.

description.x-samplevalue: These properties describe how confidential this file or folder is.

This is the security policy of the file or folder described.
Policies can be Confidential, Public or Internal.
Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value
Conflict - If a resource being created already exists
